reasoning: Chromosome 3-linked FTD is a rare genetic subtype of frontotemporal dementia. FTD overall prevalence 2-15 per 100k; genetic forms (including chromosome 3 linkage) account for 10-40% of FTD cases. Estimated prevalence 0.5-1.5 per 100k. Limited population-based data; estimates based on genetic subtype analyses.
source: Neurology and genetic studies on familial FTD subtypes
